Notes.Text:
This update for gnome-session fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2017-11171: Fix a denial of service condition. an unauthenticated local user
  can create ICE connections, causing a file descriptor leak in
  gnome-session (bsc#1048274).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 11 SP4
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 11 SP4

Vulnerabilities.Description: Bad reference counting in the context of accept_ice_connection() in gsm-xsmp-server.c in old versions of gnome-session up until version 2.29.92 allows a local attacker to establish ICE connections to gnome-session with invalid authentication data (an invalid magic cookie). Each failed authentication attempt will leak a file descriptor in gnome-session. When the maximum number of file descriptors is exhausted in the gnome-session process, it will enter an infinite loop trying to communicate without success, consuming 100% of the CPU. The graphical session associated with the gnome-session process will stop working correctly, because communication with gnome-session is no longer possible.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 11 SP4:gnome-session-2.28.0-3.11.12.2
